resources.description: Sustainable Communities Local Spending Report England  2006-07
Table One of the Sustainable Communities Local Spending Report England

organization.description:
### Expenditure Data 

There are now several detailed datasets on Government expenditure available for the UK. The most significant are Council £500 spending, the Departmental £25k spending and the Combined Online Information System (COINS).

COINS is the primary database used by HMT for recording and analysing spending. It has a pseudo-double-entry structure and is the book of "prime entry" for the budget (planning spending) and forecasted outturn (what was actually spent).

A large sample of the COINS data is publicly available at data.gov.uk. We have gathered a variety of useful information to help interpret the COINS data:

 - [Package for COINS data itself including status of current access requests](http://www.ckan.net/package/coins-data)
 - [COINS schema and field definitions](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-coins-field-definitions)

The reason that COINS is important to this project is because it contains the main high level reports on public spending and almost all other government reports on spending are directly derived from it including:

 - [Public Expenditure Statistical Analysis](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finances-pesa)
 - [Country Regional Analysis](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finances-cra)
 - [The Budget](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-budget)
 - [The Supplementary Budget Information](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-sbi)
 - [The Supply Estimates](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-main-supply-estimates)
 - Some of the [Office of National Statistics Blue Book](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-blue-book)
 - Some of the [Office of National Statistics Pink Book](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-pink-book)
 - [The Whole of Government Accounts](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-whole-of-government-accounts)

While COINS shows spending and income, we also have another dataset called the Country Regional Analysis (CRA) which shows where public spending has effect: package:ukgov-finance-cra.

### Income Data

The main package is:

 - [National income data from HMRC](http://www.ckan.net/package/hmrc-national-statistics-income-tax-and-personal-incomes)

### Additional Data

Although this isn't key data at the present it is also useful:

 - [Monthly DataBank reports of public spending](http://www.ckan.net/package/ukgov-finance-databank)   
 
[1] More details about the project -- which aims to visualise how the UK government spend public funds -- can be found at 
[Where Does My Money Go?](http://www.wheredoesmymoneygo.org/).
organization.title: Where Does My Money Go?
organization.name: wdmmg

name: uk-local-spending-report
notes:
### A Brief Introduction to Local Spending ###

UK local spending report [launched in April 2009](http://www.communities.gov.uk/news/corporate/1215052). It shows local authority out-turn spending for 2006-07.

There is an explanation of the study and it's results a [PDF](http://www.communities.gov.uk/documents/statistics/pdf/1240022.pdf) describing the project and results and a spreadsheet/form which allows a user to look up a local authority and see associated spending. This is all on the [Communities and Local Government ](http://www.communities.gov.uk/publications/corporate/statistics/localspendingreports200607) webpage. 

### Data Sources for the Report UK Local  Spending Report ###

This report contains the following data sources:

The following data sources have been used in the Local Spending Reports:

Table 1: 2006-07 Expenditure by London Boroughs, Metropolitan Districts, Shire Counties, Shire Districts and Shire Unitary Authorities 

Annual Revenue Outturn Returns 2006-07.  Communities and Local Government.

For further information see the [Communities and Local Government website](http://www.local.communities.gov.uk/finance/stats/natstats.htm#rev)

Annual Capital Outturn Returns 2006-07.  Communities and Local Government.

For further information see the [Communities and Local Government website] (http://www.local.communities.gov.uk/finance/stats/natstats.htm#cap)

Table 2: 2006-07 Expenditure by Police, Fire, Waste Disposal, Passenger Transport, Park Authorities and the Greater London Authority
Annual Revenue Outturn Returns 2006-07.  Communities and Local Government.
For further information see [the Communities and Local Government website](http://www.local.communities.gov.uk/finance/stats/natstats.htm#rev)

Annual Capital Outturn Returns 2006-07.  Communities and Local Government.
For further information see the [Communities and Local Government website](http://www.local.communities.gov.uk/finance/stats/natstats.htm#cap)

Table 3: 2006-07 Expenditure by Strategic Health Authorities
2006-07 SHA Summarisation Schedules.  Department of Health.
For further information see the [Department of Health website](http://www.nao.org.uk/publications/0708/nhs_england_accounts_2006-07.aspx)

Table 4: 2006-07 Expenditure by Ambulance Trusts
2006-07 Audited Summarisation Schedules.  Department of Health.
For further information see the [Department of Health website] (http://www.nao.org.uk/publications/0708/nhs_england_accounts_2006-07.aspx)

Table 5: 2006-07 Expenditure by NHS Trusts
2006-07 Audited Summarisation Schedules.  Department of Health.
For further information see the [Department of Health website](http://www.nao.org.uk/publications/0708/nhs_england_accounts_2006-07.aspx)

Table 6: 2006-07 Expenditure by Primary Care Trusts
2006-07 PCT Audited Summarisation Schedules.  Department of Health.
For further information see the [Department of Health website](http://www.nao.org.uk/publications/0708/nhs_england_accounts_2006-07.aspx)

Table 7: 2006-07 Expenditure by the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP)
For further information see the [Department for Work and Pensions website](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd4/medium_term.asp)

### Other Formats ###

Openly Local is currently starting to republish the data at:

  * <http://openlylocal.com/datasets/1>

and has discussed the use here: 

  * <http://countculture.wordpress.com/2010/01/05/opening-up-local-spending-reports-on-openlylocal/>

### Openness ###

Open. [Terms and Conditions](http://www.communities.gov.uk/corporate/help/conditions/#named2)
